Authors: Vázquez Á.V., Pita H.B., Gayo A.A., Fernández C.A.
Title: Performance profiles of winning and losing teams participating in the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa [Perfiles de rendimiento de selecciones ganadoras y perdedoras en el Mundial de fútbol Sudáfrica 2010]
Affiliations: Departamento de Educación Física y Deportiva, Facultade de Ciencias do Deporte e a Educación Física, Universidade da Coruña, Avd. Ernesto Che Guevara 121. Bastiagueiro, Oleiros. A Coruña, Spain; Facultad de Psicología, Departamento de Psicología Social, Básica y Metodología, Universidad de Santiago de Compostela, Spain
Authors with affiliations: Vázquez, Á.V., Departamento de Educación Física y Deportiva, Facultade de Ciencias do Deporte e a Educación Física, Universidade da Coruña, Avd. Ernesto Che Guevara 121. Bastiagueiro, Oleiros. A Coruña, Spain; Pita, H.B., Departamento de Educación Física y Deportiva, Facultade de Ciencias do Deporte e a Educación Física, Universidade da Coruña, Avd. Ernesto Che Guevara 121. Bastiagueiro, Oleiros. A Coruña, Spain; Gayo, A.A., Departamento de Educación Física y Deportiva, Facultade de Ciencias do Deporte e a Educación Física, Universidade da Coruña, Avd. Ernesto Che Guevara 121. Bastiagueiro, Oleiros. A Coruña, Spain; Fernández, C.A., Facultad de Psicología, Departamento de Psicología Social, Básica y Metodología, Universidad de Santiago de Compostela, Spain
Abstract: The aim of this study was to evaluate the competitive performance of elite football teams in order to differentiate their performance profiles, by taking the final result of the games (winning teams vs. losing teams) as a criterion. We applied a Multi-Dimensional Battery of Performance Indicators (MBPI) comprising six indices: Game Initiative Index (GII), Offensive Game Progression Index (OGPROI), Offensive Game Precision Index (OGPREI), Game Volume Index (GVI), Physical Load Index1 (PLI1) and Physical Load Index2 (PLI2). A total of 64 games from the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa were analysed. Statistical analyses of comparisons of means between winners and losers made it possible to conclude that the winning teams showed statistically higher values in four of the six performance indices used: GII (p < .001), OGPROI (p =.002), OGPREI (p = .028) and GVI (p = .001). Nonetheless, no statistically significant differences were obtained between the two groups in the PLI1 and PLI2 indices (p > .05). The MBPI may prove to be a highly useful tool for researchers and coaches in evaluating performance, and orienting training content in elite football.
Author Keywords: Football; Losing teams; Performance indicators; Team sports; Winning teams

Authors: Blanco-Rotea R., Rodríguez S.G., Mato-Fresán C., Sanjurjo-Sánchez J.
Title: The Basílica de la ascensión and os fornos (Allariz, Ourense) and the christianization of architecture in late antiquity [La Basílica da Ascensión y os fornos (Allariz, Ourense) y la cristianización de la arquitectura en la antigüedad tardía]
Affiliations: Investigadora Contratada del proyecto EMCHAHE (Marie Curie Career Integration Grant; Grant agreement PCIG12-GA-2012-334068), Laboratorio de Patrimonio, Paleoambiente e Paisaxe, Instituto de Investigacións Tecnolóxicas, Universidade de Santiago de Compostela, Ed. Monte da Condesa, USC, Campus Sur, Santiago de Compostela, Spain; Independent researcher, C/Florida 29, 3D, Vitoria, Spain; Independent researcher, C/Feliciano Barrera 11D, 4D, Santiago de Compostela, Spain; Instituto de Xeoloxía Isidro Parga Pondal, Universidade da Coruña, Campus de Elviña, Spain

Monte da Condesa, USC, Campus Sur, Santiago de Compostela, Spain; Rodríguez, S.G., Independent researcher, C/Florida 29, 3D, Vitoria, Spain; Mato-Fresán, C., Independent researcher, C/Feliciano Barrera 11D, 4D, Santiago de Compostela, Spain; Sanjurjo-Sánchez, J., Instituto de Xeoloxía Isidro Parga Pondal, Universidade da Coruña, Campus de Elviña, Spain
Abstract: This paper offers a review of the results of different archaeological projects carried out in the archaeological complex of Basilica de la Ascensión and Os Fornos. This monument has been reused from the Iron Age to the present. Special importance will be given to the transformation of the Iron Age sweat lodge into a christian building linked to the martyrdom of Santa Mariña, in the 6th century. Later transformations will consolidate the christian use of the monument. © 2015, Associacao Portuguesa para o Desenvolvimento Regional (APDR). All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Analysis of mortars; Archaeology of architecture; Early christianism; Galicia; Iron age; Late antiquity; Santa mariña; Stratigraphic analysis of walls; Sweat-lodge

Authors: Bobadilla Pérez M.
Title: Textual didactics in the transitional period between the middle ages and the renaissance: Carnavalesque resources in the Book of Good Love [El didactismo textual en la transición de la edad media al renacimiento: Recursos carnavalescos en El libro del Buen Amor]
Affiliations: Universidade da Coruña, Spain
Authors with affiliations: Bobadilla Pérez, M., Universidade da Coruña, Spain
Abstract: This article explores The Book of Good Love by the Arcipreste de Hita from an educational standpoint. The work of the Arcipreste reproduces the social changes that are taking place during the transitional period between the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. During this time the bases of a new social group, the bourgeoisie, are being established. In the educational system, the Church still has a prominent role, but at this time new urban schools are appearing, with a less religious focus. Naturally, this emerging bourgeois class is still little refined and lacks didactic resources, therefore it must make use of the existing religious texts in combination with profane ones in order to build the corpus of the new educational paradigm. Focusing on the allegorical episode which describes the battle between Don Carnal and Doña Cuaresma, I consider the carnavalesque essence of The Book of Good Love through Mijaíl Mijáilovich Bajtín´s theoretical perspectives. Hence, I will explore how through the representation of the carnival the Arcipreste aims to carry out the ex contrario teaching model to which he refers to in the prologue of his work, and making use of contrapositions and ambiguities he fulfils his moral teaching aim. © 2015,Sociedad Espanola de Estudios Literarios de Cultura Popular. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Carnival; Didactics; Education; The Book of Good Love

Authors: Remeseiro B., Fernández A., Lira M.
Title: Automatic eye blink detection using consumer web cameras
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: Departamento de Computación, Universidade da Coruña, A Coruña, Spain; Centro de Física, Universidade do Minho, Guimarães, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Remeseiro, B., Departamento de Computación, Universidade da Coruña, A Coruña, Spain; Fernández, A., Departamento de Computación, Universidade da Coruña, A Coruña, Spain; Lira, M., Centro de Física, Universidade do Minho, Guimarães, Portugal
Abstract: This research aims to advance blinking detection in the context of work activity. Rather than patients having to attend a clinic, blinking videos can be acquired in a work environment, and further automatically analyzed. Therefore, this paper presents a methodology to perform the automatic detection of eye blink using consumer videos acquired with low-cost web cameras. This methodology includes the detection of the face and eyes of the recorded person, and then it analyzes the lowlevel features of the eye region to create a quantitative vector. Finally, this vector is classified into one of the two categories considered —open and closed eyes— by using machine learning algorithms. The effectiveness of the proposed methodology was demonstrated since it provides unbiased results with classification errors under 5%. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2015.
Author Keywords: Classification; Clinical application; Eye blink; Feature extraction; Image processing; Pattern recognition
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Cameras; Classification (of information); Feature extraction; Image processing; Learning algorithms; Learning systems; Neural networks; Social networking (online); Automatic Detection; Classification errors; Clinical application; Consumer videos; Eye blink; Eye-blink detections; Low-level features; Work environments; Pattern recognition

Authors: Fernández R.C., Vázquez M.D.M., Chao A.M.L.
Title: Are music and mathematics worked on in an interdisciplinary way during early childhood education? [¿Se trabajan de forma interdisciplinar música y matemáticas en educación infantil?]
Affiliations: Departamento de Composición, Universidade da Coruña, Coruña, Spain; Departamento de Pedagogía y Didáctica, Universidade da Coruña, Coruña, Spain; Universidade da Coruña, Coruña, Spain
Authors with affiliations: Fernández, R.C., Departamento de Composición, Universidade da Coruña, Coruña, Spain; Vázquez, M.D.M., Departamento de Pedagogía y Didáctica, Universidade da Coruña, Coruña, Spain; Chao, A.M.L., Universidade da Coruña, Coruña, Spain
Abstract: The purpose of this investigation is to analyse whether music and mathematics are subjects taught in an interdisciplinary way in the earliest school years, a methodological option that had a great impact in the past few years on this educational stage, opposed to the traditional methods. The sample is made up by 360 teachers of early childhood education and musical education from both public and private schools in the province of a Coruña (Galicia, Spain). To carry through the analysis, we designed a questionnaire that was applied in November 2013. The results show that most of the teachers belong to public schools and give the same importance to both subjects, music and mathematics. They consider that it is important to work on them in an interdisciplinary way, as that improves the integral academic training of students. In the majority of the cases, there exists a different teacher for each subject, and they do not program or use materials and activities jointly, although they do evaluate in a interdisciplinary manner. Lastly, in the discussion we make certain final considerations that evidence what makes investigation important, as our findings allow us to know what is happening in the classrooms and lead us to confirm the need for teacher education to give an impulse to the teaching-learning process of music and mathematics through interdisciplinarity.
Author Keywords: Early childhood education; Interdisciplinarity; Mathematics; Music; Teaching-learning

Authors: Oliveira A., Oliveira T., Macías S., Antonio
Title: Distribution function for the ratio of two normal random variables
Affiliations: Universidade Aberta, CEAUL, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal; Universidade da Coruña, Universidad Nacional de Educación A Distancia (UNED), Spain
Authors with affiliations: Oliveira, A., Universidade Aberta, CEAUL, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal; Oliveira, T., Universidade Aberta, CEAUL, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal; Macías, S.; Antonio, Universidade da Coruña, Universidad Nacional de Educación A Distancia (UNED), Spain
Abstract: The distribution of the ratio of two normal random variables X and Y was studied from [1] (the density function) and [2] (the distribution function). The shape of its density function can be uni-modal, bimodal, symmetric, asymmetric, following several type of distributions, like Dirac Distribution, Normal Distribution, Cauchy Distribution or Recinormal Distribution. In this paper we study a different approximation for this distribution Z = X /Y, as a function of four parameters: ratio of the means of the two normal variables, ratio of the standard deviations of the two normal variables, the variation coefficient of the normal variable Y, and the correlation between the two variables. A formula for the Distribution function and the density function of Z is given. In addition, using graphical procedures we established singularity points for the parameters where the approximation given for Z has a non normal shape. © 2015 AIP Publishing LLC.
Author Keywords: Cumulative density distribution; Density function; Fieller distribution; Ratio two normal variables; Uncorrelated normal variables
References: Fieller, E., The distribution of the index in a normal bivariate population (1932) Biometrika, 24, pp. 428-440; Hinkler, D., On the ratio of two correlated normal random variables (1969) Biometrika, 56, pp. 635-639; Del Prado Martin, F.M., A theory of reaction time distribution, Tech. rep. (2008) Laboratoire de Psycologie Cognitive (UMR-6146); Marsaglia, G., Ratios of normal variables (2006) Journal of Statistical Software, 16. , http://www.jstatsoft.org/v16/i04; Dias Francés, E., Rubio, F.J., On the existence of a normal approximation to the distribution of the ratio of two independent normal random variables (2013) Statistical Papers, 54, pp. 309-323
Sponsors: Santilli Foundation
Conference name: International Conference on Numerical Analysis and Applied Mathematics 2014, ICNAAM 2014

Authors: Grela E.B., Bobadilla-Pérez M.
Title: Una mujer desnuda by Lola Beccaria: Spaces and writings of the body [Una mujer desnuda, de Lola Beccaria: Espacios y escrituras del cuerpo]
Affiliations: Universidade da Coruña, Spain
Authors with affiliations: Grela, E.B., Universidade da Coruña, Spain; Bobadilla-Pérez, M., Universidade da Coruña, Spain
Abstract: This article discusses the applicability of postfeminist discourse to contemporary Spanish cultural production. Incited by the apparent confrontation with traditional feminist thinking, postfeminist theories are thought to be an obstacle to the rights of women in contemporary societies. Bearing in mind such complications of the term, our essay questions the recent criticism that postfeminism has received in the last few years and tries to elucidate how its implications affect the progressive development of the achievements of previous or simultaneous feminisms. Such discussion is presented in this essay through the study of the narrative texts of Lola Beccaria and La Fura dels Baus, who respectively present in her novel (Una mujer desnuda, 2004) and their film (Fausto 5.0, 2001) features of the feminine subjectivity in collision with the masculine gazes of the discourses that partake in the construction of the feminine characters. Copyright © Taylor & Francis Group, LLC.
